description: From Middle English elswher, from Old English elles hwǣr and elles hwerġen (“elsewhere”); corresponding with else +‎ where.

entries.meaning: Synonym of somewhere else: in, at, or to some other place.
examples: If you won’t serve us, we’ll go elsewhere.
These particular trees are not to be found elsewhere.

entries.meaning: Synonym of somewhere else: a place other than here.
examples: We are back on the Ligurian coast, from which vertigos push human beings toward all kinds of elsewheres.
